meanings.definition: Actively break the terms of (a law, agreement, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He knew he would infringe the rules if he skipped class.
meanings.sent2: She was worried that her actions might infringe the company's policy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to infringe the 'no stealing birdseed' rule.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior seemed to constantly infringe the boundaries set by society.
meanings.sent5: The image of the broken lock symbolized his tendency to infringe rules.

meanings.definition: Act so as to limit or undermine (something)
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain could infringe our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: They didn't want to infringe on their neighbor's privacy by peeking over the fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to infringe the dog's nap by pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The loud construction noise seemed to constantly infringe on her peaceful afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds began to infringe upon the clear blue sky, signaling an approaching storm.
